sources.title: Nature Communications

articles.author: Pierre Raia
articles.description: Inositol pyrophosphates are key nutrient messengers in fungi, plants and animals. This study uncovers the structure and function of a critical enzyme involved in their production and breakdown, revealing how cells control inositol pyrophosphate levels to regulate nutrient signaling.
articles.title: A small signaling domain controls PPIP5K phosphatase activity in phosphate homeostasis

articles.author: Taylor Priest
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Seasonal recurrence and modular assembly of an Arctic pelagic marine microbiome
articles.title: Author Correction: Seasonal recurrence and modular assembly of an Arctic pelagic marine microbiome

articles.author: Christiaan G. J. Saris
articles.description: Nature Communications - Should we be careful with exercise in post-exertional malaise after long COVID?
articles.title: Should we be careful with exercise in post-exertional malaise after long COVID?

articles.author: Brent Appelman
articles.description: Nature Communications - Reply to: Should we be careful with exercise in post-exertional malaise after Long COVID?
articles.title: Reply to: Should we be careful with exercise in post-exertional malaise after Long COVID?

articles.author: Yaoyao Sun
articles.description: Childhood maltreatment interacts with genes to increase depression risk. Here, Sun et al. use a genome-wide approach to identify variants of IDO2 associated with depression in individuals who have undergone child maltreatment.
articles.title: Genome-wide interaction association analysis identifies interactive effects of childhood maltreatment and kynurenine pathway on depression

articles.author: Andreas Luttens
articles.description: Fragment-based drug design is an efficient yet challenging approach for developing therapeutics. Here, the authors employ structure-based docking screens of vast fragment libraries to identify inhibitors of 8-oxoguanine DNA glycosylase, a difficult drug target implicated in cancer and inflammation.
articles.title: Virtual fragment screening for DNA repair inhibitors in vast chemical space

articles.author: Sayantanee Paul
articles.description: The underlying mechanism of acquired resistance to targeted therapy in cancer remains to be explored. Here, the authors show that upregulation of the FOSL1 transcription factor restores YAP/TEAD occupancy on chromatin to drive resistance to GNE-7883, an allosteric TEAD inhibitor.
articles.title: Cooperation between the Hippo and MAPK pathway activation drives acquired resistance to TEAD inhibition

articles.author: Rana El Masri
articles.description: Here, the authors have identified a mutation in the gene GNA13 in patients with hypomelanosis of Ito and developmental anomalies, which triggers excessive RHOA/ROCK signaling and actin polymerization, leading to melanocyte rounding and failure in melanosome transfer to keratinocytes.
articles.title: A postzygotic GNA13 variant upregulates the RHOA/ROCK pathway and alters melanocyte function in a mosaic skin hypopigmentation syndrome

articles.author: Yoko Tajima
articles.description: The neuron-specific RNA binding protein NOVA1 has a single amino acid substitution unique to modern humans. Here, the authors characterize the evolutional specificity and the function of the substitution. Studies using humanized NOVA1 mice reveal its specific effects on splicing and vocalization.
articles.title: A humanized NOVA1 splicing factor alters mouse vocal communications

articles.author: Zhu Cheng
articles.description: Current Li||I2 batteries suffer from limited capacity and polyiodides shuttling. Here, authors showcase a four-electron all-solid-state Li||I2 battery using a chloride-rich solid electrolyte that enables a solid-phase reversible I-/I2/I+ conversion, achieving high capacity and enhanced safety.
articles.title: Realizing four-electron conversion chemistry for all-solid-state Li||I<sub>2</sub> batteries at room temperature

articles.author: Emmanuel Labaronne
articles.description: Here, integrating ribosome profiling, RNA-seq and proteomics to reveal transcriptional and post-translational regulation in HIV-infected T cells, the authors show that non-AUG translation of viral upstream ORFs elicits distinct immune responses and regulates viral gene expression in a DDX3-dependent manner.
articles.title: Non-AUG HIV-1 uORF translation elicits specific T cell immune response and regulates viral transcript expression

articles.author: Lisa Bertrand
articles.description: Here, using ribosomal profiling, the authors characterize the translatome of HIV-1 revealing tens of alternative open reading frames (ARF) that encode conserved viral antigens and show that ARF-derived peptides elicit potent HIV-specific poly-functional immune responses mediated by both CD4+ and CD8+ T cells.
articles.title: Unveiling conserved HIV-1 open reading frames encoding T cell antigens using ribosome profiling

articles.author: Chao Lyu
articles.description: This study introduces a framework for hybrid seismic simulations in regions with solid-fluid boundaries, enabling imaging of fine-scale structures anywhere within the Earth.
articles.title: Efficient hybrid numerical modeling of the seismic wavefield in the presence of solid-fluid boundaries

articles.author: Hangfeng Zhang
articles.description: Erbium-doped lead magnesium niobium titanate ceramics demonstrate ultrahigh strain and piezoelectric coefficients under low electric fields, setting a benchmark for piezoelectric materials and offering versatile applications in precision actuators and sensors.
articles.title: Phase transformation in lead titanate based relaxor ferroelectrics with ultra-high strain

articles.author: Xiaohong Zhang
articles.description: The stability and delivery of biopesticides limits application. Here, azadirachtin is co-assembled with plant secondary metabolites for efficient drug delivery, demonstrating pest management, the activation of plant defensive capacity, while increasing the production yield of crops.
articles.title: Sustainable pest management using plant secondary metabolites regulated azadirachtin nano-assemblies

articles.author: Jizhong Wang
articles.description: Metabolic dysfunction is an important characteristic of vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs) phenotypic transition in aortic dissection. Here, the authors show lncRNA H19 could encode a peptide, GMRSP. GMRSP regulates the glycolysis by counteracting hnRNP A2B1-mediated pyruvate kinase M pre-mRNA alternative splicing and control the phenotypic transition of VSMCs.
articles.title: GMRSP encoded by lncRNA H19 regulates metabolic reprogramming and alleviates aortic dissection

articles.author: Thomas Faherty
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Acute particulate matter exposure diminishes executive cognitive functioning after four hours regardless of inhalation pathway
articles.title: Author Correction: Acute particulate matter exposure diminishes executive cognitive functioning after four hours regardless of inhalation pathway

articles.author: Tara Muijlwijk
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Hallmarks of a genomically distinct subclass of head and neck cancer
articles.title: Author Correction: Hallmarks of a genomically distinct subclass of head and neck cancer

articles.author: Chunlan Zhuang
articles.description: Effectiveness of the hepatitis E vaccine HEV 239 amongst high-risk groups isn’t well studied. Here, Zhuang et al. analyse a decade of surveillance data (2007–2017) from Dongtai, China, and estimate HEV 239 effectiveness of 72% amongst hepatitis B virus infected people.
articles.title: Effectiveness of a hepatitis E vaccine against medically-attended symptomatic infection in HBsAg-positive adults from a test-negative design study

articles.author: Jana Marielle Modenbach
articles.description: Here, the authors show that cystatin C (CST3) regulates the activity of cathepsin B during pancreatitis in a pH dependent manner. Moreover, cathepsin B activity is inhibited by monomeric CST3 but activated by dimeric CST3.
articles.title: Biochemical analyses of cystatin-C dimers and cathepsin-B reveals a trypsin-driven feedback mechanism in acute pancreatitis

articles.author: Clare MacRae
articles.description: The ability to manage ill health and care needs might be affected by who a person lives with. Here, authors show that living alone or with co-residents with multimorbidity poses additional risk for unplanned hospitalisation and care home transition beyond an individual’s characteristics.
articles.title: Impact of household size and co-resident multimorbidity on unplanned hospitalisation and transition to care home

articles.author: Tushar P. Patel
articles.description: Systemic lipid homeostasis requires hepatic autophagy to recycle intracellular fat. Here, the authors identify peripheral mechanisms regulating energy homeostasis, showing that MC3R is a regulator of hepatic autophagy, hepatic fat accumulation, and fat partitioning, controlling systemic adiposity.
articles.title: Melanocortin 3 receptor regulates hepatic autophagy and systemic adiposity

articles.author: ChulMin Oh
articles.description: Optical aberrations can hinder the quality of imaging outputs, affecting research across many disciplines. Here, using the tilt-tilt correlation from the optical memory effect, the authors are able to correct aberrations in challenging conditions, including highly aberrated or moving samples.
articles.title: Digital aberration correction for enhanced thick tissue imaging exploiting aberration matrix and tilt-tilt correlation from the optical memory effect

articles.author: Qirui Feng
articles.description: Plant growth promoting rhizobacteria can replace chemical fertilizers, but they are susceptible to harsh environmental conditions. Here, the authors report on a protective hydrogel for promoting rhizobacteria colonization to enhance growth and improve adaptability of plants to acidic soil.
articles.title: Rhizobacteria protective hydrogel to promote plant growth and adaption to acidic soil

articles.author: Ze Zhang
articles.description: Here, the authors use cryo electron tomography to investigate the in-situ assembly mechanisms of clustered protocadherin γB4, uncovering the functional contributions of full-length γB4 and role played by specific domains.
articles.title: Structural insights into the in situ assembly of clustered protocadherin γB4

articles.author: Zhi-Hao Wang
articles.description: Oral drug delivery system has clinical potential for colorectal cancer (CRC) drug therapy but limited by the delivery efficiency when transporting through the formidable intestinal barriers. Here this group reports a Lactobacillus rhamnosus-engineered mesoporous silica nanosystem which effectively penetrates intestinal mucus and epithelial barrier, thereby delivering NO donor BNN6 and cisplatin for in vivo CRC tumor growth inhibition.
articles.title: Bioactive nanomotor enabling efficient intestinal barrier penetration for colorectal cancer therapy

articles.author: Bin Liu
articles.description: A nitrate-induced transcription factor TaTCP6 is identified as a central regulator for the efficient and balanced utilization of nitrate and phosphorus, and a moderate increase in its expression promotes wheat yield.
articles.title: TaTCP6 is required for efficient and balanced utilization of nitrate and phosphorus in wheat

articles.author: Jingyang Qian
articles.description: Deciphering the features, structure, and functions of the cell niche in tissues remains a major challenge. Here, the authors develop scNiche, a computational framework to identify and characterise cell niches from spatial omics data at single-cell resolution.
articles.title: Identification and characterization of cell niches in tissue from spatial omics data at single-cell resolution

articles.author: Ana García García
articles.description: Overexpression of c-MYC regulates tumor metabolism in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). Here the authors identify ELOVL6, a fatty acid elongase regulated by c-MYC, as a potential therapeutic target of PDAC.
articles.title: Targeting ELOVL6 to disrupt c-MYC driven lipid metabolism in pancreatic cancer enhances chemosensitivity

articles.author: Courtney A. Lovejoy
articles.description: Accurate chromosome segregation into daughter cells depends on proper compaction and disentanglement. The authors uncover SRBD1 as a key mediator of these essential processes that localizes topoisomerase IIα to mitotic chromosomes.
articles.title: SRBD1 facilitates chromosome segregation by promoting topoisomerase IIα localization to mitotic chromosomes

articles.author: Swastika Banerjee
articles.description: This study demonstrates the role of non-local exchange and correlation interactions in solid electrolytes (SEs) for lithium-ion batteries. Through analysis of argyrodite SEs, it reveals how non-local interactions influence lithium diffusion and structural stability, guiding future SE design.
articles.title: Non-local interactions determine local structure and lithium diffusion in solid electrolytes

articles.author: Hannah R. Hrncir
articles.description: The bile ducts of the liver form a network of large ducts and small ductules, though how they are patterned remains unclear. Hrncir et al. show that Sox9 is required for the morphogenesis of small intrahepatic bile ductules in mice, highlighting distinct genetic requirements that drive bile duct heterogeneity.
articles.title: Sox9 inhibits Activin A to promote biliary maturation and branching morphogenesis

articles.author: William A. Stocker
articles.description: Domestic cats are sterilized via ovariohysterectomy, but this procedure is not feasible for the larger population of free-roaming cats. Here they show that injecting high levels of anti-Müllerian hormone (AMH) disrupts ovarian function and the maintenance of pregnancy in female domestic cats, suggesting that AMH gene therapy could be used for feline fertility control.
articles.title: Gene therapy with feline anti-Müllerian hormone analogs disrupts folliculogenesis and induces pregnancy loss in female domestic cats

articles.author: Juraj Velcicky
articles.description: IL-36 receptor is crucial for host defense and tissue repair. Here, the authors describe identification and characterization of low molecular weight inhibitors of the IL-36 receptor using encoded library technologies. This represents a rare example of small molecules inhibiting a member of IL-1 receptor family.
articles.title: Discovery of selective low molecular weight interleukin-36 receptor antagonists by encoded library technologies

articles.author: Ramon Duran-Romaña
articles.description: During vectorial protein translation, native interactions are temporarily unsatisfied. Here, authors introduce “Native Fold Delay”, integrating protein topology with translation kinetics to quantify the resulting delays in co-translational folding which may result in protein aggregation.
articles.title: Native Fold Delay and its implications for co-translational chaperone binding and protein aggregation

articles.author: Xiu Liu
articles.description: The realization of active metasurfaces operating in the infrared range remains challenging due to design complexities and scarcity of suitable materials. Here, the authors report the realization of electrically programmable plasmonic metasurfaces integrated with graphene transistors, enabling pixelated thermal emission with low cross-talk and enhanced coherence.
articles.title: Electrically programmable pixelated coherent mid-infrared thermal emission

articles.author: Shengjie Wei
articles.description: Breaking the geometric symmetry of metal-N4 sites and boosting catalytic activity are significant but challenging. Here, using chlorination engineering, authors convert the Zn-N4 site with low activity and selectivity for the electroreduction of CO2 into highly active Zn-N3 site with broken symmetry.
articles.title: Planar chlorination engineering induced symmetry-broken single-atom site catalyst for enhanced CO<sub>2</sub> electroreduction

articles.author: Georgy Antonov
articles.description: Exploration is vital for efficient and successful learning. Here, the authors propose a normative account of the role of hippocampal replay in generating approximately optimal exploratory choices.
articles.title: Exploring replay

articles.author: Jiapeng Zheng
articles.description: OLEDs that emit circularly polarized light are essential for many technologies. Here, the authors develop OLEDs based on chiral nanoparticles that have large emission dissymmetry factors and high external quantum efficiencies.
articles.title: Circularly polarized OLEDs from chiral plasmonic nanoparticle-molecule hybrids

articles.author: Kenta Yokoi
articles.description: Lycopodium alkaloids are attractive synthetic targets due to their diverse and unusual skeletal features, but there remain synthetic challenges to several lycopodium alkaloids. Here, the authors report the synthesis of several lycoposerramine congeners in 10 steps or less by employing a nitrogen deletion strategy for late-stage fragment coupling.
articles.title: Enantioselective total synthesis of lycoposerramine congeners through late-stage nitrogen deletion

articles.author: Letian Chen
articles.description: The realization of circularly polarized organic light-emitting diodes with narrow-spectrum emission and high efficiency is challenging. Here, authors report an approach for these devices by developing chiral thermally activated delayed fluorescence sensitizers for achiral multi-resonance emitters.
articles.title: Hyperfluorescence circularly polarized OLEDs consisting of chiral TADF sensitizers and achiral multi-resonance emitters

articles.author: Bing Wang
articles.description: Bacterial transcription factor Rho (ρ) is a key regulator of transcription termination. Here, the authors show that Escherichia coli ρ forms inactive oligomers and filaments in the presence of stress-associated nucleotides (p)ppGpp and ADP.
articles.title: Nucleotide-induced hyper-oligomerization inactivates transcription termination factor ρ

articles.author: Francesco Carli
articles.description: Potential anti-tumor therapies remain to be discovered in cancer cell line high-throughput screening datasets. Here, the authors develop a machine learning approach to infer cancer cell drug sensitivity from transcriptomics data and to explore drug mechanisms of action, and predict effective drugs for pancreatic cancer and glioblastoma.
articles.title: Learning and actioning general principles of cancer cell drug sensitivity

articles.author: Nicolò Canestrari
articles.description: The icosahedron is the most symmetrical solid structure and is found in metal clusters, colloidal aggregates, viruses and organelles. Here, the authors propose a general theory for the design of multi-component icosahedral aggregates by packing shells of different types.
articles.title: General theory for packing icosahedral shells into multi-component aggregates

articles.author: Xinrong Xie
articles.description: Non-Hermiticity is usually considered detrimental to quasiparticle physics. Here, the authors show that such an assumption of Hermiticity can be lifted in the context of a lattice model containing two non-Hermitian Dirac cones, with one hosting amplifying Dirac quasiparticles and the other hosting decaying ones.
articles.title: Non-Hermitian Dirac cones with valley-dependent lifetimes

articles.author: Xiaofeng Huang
articles.description: The suboptimal performance of perovskite solar cells based on non-fullerene acceptor as the electron-transporting layer underscores the need for their molecular engineering. Here, authors substitute the core of Y6 with phenanthroline and crown ether, achieving a certified efficiency of 25.59%.
articles.title: Supramolecular force-driven non-fullerene acceptors as an electron-transporting layer for efficient inverted perovskite solar cells

articles.author: Gokul Iyer
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: A multi-model study to inform the United States’ 2035 NDC
articles.title: Author Correction: A multi-model study to inform the United States’ 2035 NDC

articles.author: Wentao Zheng
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: ReaL-MGE is a tool for enhanced multiplex genome engineering and application to malonyl-CoA anabolism
articles.title: Author Correction: ReaL-MGE is a tool for enhanced multiplex genome engineering and application to malonyl-CoA anabolism

articles.author: Yimiao Feng
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Benchmarking machine learning methods for synthetic lethality prediction in cancer
articles.title: Author Correction: Benchmarking machine learning methods for synthetic lethality prediction in cancer

articles.author: Arun Chandramohan
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Design-rules for stapled peptides with in vivo activity and their application to Mdm2/X antagonists
articles.title: Author Correction: Design-rules for stapled peptides with in vivo activity and their application to Mdm2/X antagonists

articles.author: Emmeline E. Brown
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Physics-informed deep generative learning for quantitative assessment of the retina
articles.title: Author Correction: Physics-informed deep generative learning for quantitative assessment of the retina

articles.author: Savannah E. R. Gibson
articles.description: Processes that occur after death have not received the same level of attention as the mechanisms of life. In this study, the authors show that bacteria have potentially evolved an altruistic trait to auto-degrade after death, thus permitting population nutrient recycling.
articles.title: Bacteria encode post-mortem protein catabolism that enables altruistic nutrient recycling

articles.author: Binmeng Chen
articles.description: Silane coupling agents retard early hydration when incorporated into fresh cement paste. Here the authors show how silane coupling agents hinder calcium dissolution of tricalcium silicate from ab initio metadynamics simulations and hydration experiments.
articles.title: Molecular elucidation of cement hydration inhibition by silane coupling agents

articles.author: Chenkai Zhao
articles.description: COVID-19-related non-pharmaceutical interventions impacted the circulation of other pathogens. Here, the authors compile a global viral activity dataset and compare the timing of resurgence of seven common respiratory viruses following the relaxation of interventions across different geographical regions.
articles.title: Characterising the asynchronous resurgence of common respiratory viruses following the COVID-19 pandemic

articles.author: Zhang Zhang
articles.description: Information dynamics are key in complex systems. The authors apply graph neural networks to group components for coarse-graining networks, reducing computational complexity. Their approach preserves information flow under compression, being effective for large networks.
articles.title: Coarse-graining network flow through statistical physics and machine learning

articles.author: Anna Johannesman
articles.description: Toxin-antitoxin systems make up a branch of the bacterial anti-phage immune system. Here, Johannesman et al demonstrate that some phages have co-opted an orphan antitoxin to counter a DNA ADP-ribosyltransferase defense system.
articles.title: Phages carry orphan antitoxin-like enzymes to neutralize the DarTG1 toxin-antitoxin defense system

articles.author: Zhen Sun
articles.description: The crystallographically forbidden fivefold symmetry in icosahedra remains a long-standing mystery. Here, the authors resolve the three-dimensional atomic structure of Janus-like icosahedral nanoparticles with atomic resolution by electron tomography.
articles.title: Strain release by 3D atomic misfit in fivefold twinned icosahedral nanoparticles with amorphization and dislocations

articles.author: Micaela Rodriguez
articles.description: Loneliness is a widespread problem that the media and public health campaigns frequently address. Here, the authors show that negative media portrayals of being alone may inadvertently make matters worse by shaping people’s beliefs, which in turn exacerbate loneliness.
articles.title: How people think about being alone shapes their experience of loneliness

articles.author: Youcai Xiong
articles.description: Prime editing systems (PEs) hold great promise though the editing range is limited to downstream sequences of the pegRNA nick. Here, the authors report the extended prime editor system (EXPERT), which overcomes this limitation enabling efficient editing on both sides of the pegRNA nick.
articles.title: EXPERT expands prime editing efficiency and range of large fragment edits

articles.author: Rabindra Khadka
articles.description: Some bacteria use a large protein complex, the stressosome, to sense and respond to environmental stress. Here, Khadka et al. show that a long-assumed sensor in the complex is dispensable for sensing, while a protein formerly considered a mere messenger is crucial.
articles.title: Stressosome-independent but RsbT-dependent environmental stress sensing in Bacillus subtilis

articles.author: Yanpeng Li
articles.description: The induction of autoimmune symptoms may require both endogenous and exogenous cues. Here the authors show that a single nucleotide polymorphism in the NCF1 gene, NCF1R90H, known to be associated with systemic lupus erythematosus synergizes with mouse norovirus virus infection to promote interferon and toll-like receptor signaling to cause lupus symptoms in mice.
articles.title: The systemic lupus erythematosus-associated NCF1<sup>90H</sup> allele synergizes with viral infection to cause mouse lupus but also limits virus spread

articles.author: Pratibha Singh
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Dysregulation of MMP2-dependent TGF-ß2 activation impairs fibrous cap formation in type 2 diabetes-associated atherosclerosis
articles.title: Author Correction: Dysregulation of MMP2-dependent TGF-ß2 activation impairs fibrous cap formation in type 2 diabetes-associated atherosclerosis

articles.author: Giuseppe Lucia
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Atlantic Ocean thermal forcing of Central American rainfall over 140,000 years
articles.title: Author Correction: Atlantic Ocean thermal forcing of Central American rainfall over 140,000 years

articles.author: Le Liu
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Isospin competitions and valley polarized correlated insulators in twisted double bilayer graphene
articles.title: Author Correction: Isospin competitions and valley polarized correlated insulators in twisted double bilayer graphene

articles.author: Zhuangzhuang Cui
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Molecular anchoring of free solvents for high-voltage and high-safety lithium metal batteries
articles.title: Author Correction: Molecular anchoring of free solvents for high-voltage and high-safety lithium metal batteries

articles.author: Jie Zhang
articles.description: Ferroelectrics, which exhibit excellent charge separation ability, suffer from poor photocatalytic activity. The authors unveil the limitations in charge extraction and offer strategies to design high-performance photocatalysts by eliminating surface defects.
articles.title: Unveiling charge utilization mechanisms in ferroelectric for water splitting

articles.author: Chunyan Zhao
articles.description: Precise control over the characteristics of crystalline conjugated polymers is essential for organic electronic, but this is complex. Here, the authors report a molecular dipole orienting strategy for preparation of single-crystal thin films with high transistor mobility.
articles.title: Molecular-dipole oriented universal growth of conjugated polymers into semiconducting single-crystal thin films

articles.author: Jakob Steinfeldt
articles.description: Nature Communications - Author Correction: Medical history predicts phenome-wide disease onset and enables the rapid response to emerging health threats
articles.title: Author Correction: Medical history predicts phenome-wide disease onset and enables the rapid response to emerging health threats

articles.author: Dominik Koll
articles.description: Several Pacific deep-ocean ferromanganese crusts record an anomalous increase of the cosmogenic radionuclide 10Be around 10.1 Ma. This anomaly is a potential independent time marker for the late Miocene.
articles.title: A cosmogenic <sup>10</sup>Be anomaly during the late Miocene as independent time marker for marine archives

articles.author: Romanos Sklavenitis-Pistofidis
articles.description: The impact of tumor intrinsic and immune alterations on disease progression in patients with Waldenstrom’s Macroglobulinemia (WM) remains to be characterized. Here, the authors perform single-cell RNA-sequencing and identify distinct tumor subtypes, tumour microenvironment features and potential therapeutic vulnerabilities in patients with WM.
articles.title: Single-cell RNA sequencing defines distinct disease subtypes and reveals hypo-responsiveness to interferon in asymptomatic Waldenstrom’s Macroglobulinemia

articles.author: Meng Yan
articles.description: Genome structure exhibits significant plasticity, enabling it to tolerate alterations induced by chromosome fusions. Here, authors introduce a K-matrix approach to visualise genome structure and analyse chromosome movements, providing further evidence for the principle of genome organisation homeostasis.
articles.title: Visualization of chromosomal reorganization induced by heterologous fusions in the mammalian nucleus

articles.author: Raquel A. Martínez García de la Torre
articles.description: Here, the authors investigate the proteome trajectory of human iPSCs differentiating into hepatic stellate cells (diHSCs) and identify RORA as a key transcription factor that governs metabolic reprogramming essential for diHSCs’ commitment, identity, and quiescent phenotype.
articles.title: Trajectory analysis of hepatic stellate cell differentiation reveals metabolic regulation of cell commitment and fibrosis

articles.author: Baiwei Ma
articles.description: Interactions among insects, plants, and microorganisms are fundamental for ecosystem function. This study focuses on the attraction of oriental armyworm moths to yeast-fermented nectar and finds that isoamyl alcohol, a yeast-derived compound, activates specific olfactory neurons in the moths, enhancing yeast dispersal and moth reproduction.
articles.title: Yeast-derived volatiles orchestrate an insect-yeast mutualism with oriental armyworm moths

articles.author: Yulong Dong
articles.description: Fault-tolerant quantum computing would require very high accuracy in quantum gate characterisation. Here, the authors introduce an optimal low-depth phase estimation method inspired by quantum signal processing, significantly improving gate calibration accuracy.
articles.title: Optimal low-depth quantum signal-processing phase estimation

articles.author: Noah Schwarz
articles.description: Cyclopentadienyl ligands are central to organometallic lanthanide chemistry as their electron-donating ability enables fine-tuning for various applications including catalysis, luminescent materials, and single molecule magnets. Here, the authors report the synthesis and characterization of the lanthanide complexes featuring η5-coordinating heterocyclic stibolyl and bismolyl ligands.
articles.title: Rare earth stibolyl and bismolyl sandwich complexes

sources.title: Nature Sustainability

articles.author: Christopher W. Callahan
articles.description: While adaptation to climate and environmental impacts is assumed for future development, this Perspective provides evidence that adaptation may be more limited or even undermined by climate change, requiring difficult societal decisions to be made.
articles.title: Present and future limits to climate change adaptation

articles.author: Stuart Pimm
articles.description: Advanced remote sensing shows illegal deforestation as it happens, allowing for prompt action when there is the political will to stop it, argues Stuart Pimm.
articles.title: When deforestation happens and should not

articles.author: Silvana Amaral
articles.description: The highly biodiverse Brazilian Atlantic Forest has a long history of deforestation and only a small portion of the original forest remains. This study examines the spatial and temporal patterns of this deforestation to understand the effectiveness of current laws at curbing forest loss.
articles.title: Alarming patterns of mature forest loss in the Brazilian Atlantic Forest

articles.author: Wilson H. McNeil
articles.description: Grid decarbonization and truck electrification investments in the United States aim to support a just energy transition. Although such efforts reduce air-pollution-related premature mortality in disadvantaged communities, the relative disparity between disadvantaged and non-disadvantaged communities increases.
articles.title: Impact of truck electrification on air pollution disparities in the United States

articles.author: Xiaoyan Xu
articles.description: PM2.5 pollution can have a detrimental effect on human health, especially for elderly populations, due to the ageing process. This study examines the social–economic impact of such pollution on different age segments and healthcare systems across Japan, a country with a super-ageing society.
articles.title: Rising socio-economic costs of PM<sub>2.5</sub> pollution and medical service mismatching

articles.author: Irene Y. Feng
articles.description: Wind erosion and dust transport present challenges to human wellbeing, health and infrastructure. Last estimated for the United States in the 1990s, present economic costs of wind erosion across the United States have nearly quadrupled, and an updated assessment of vulnerable systems is required.
articles.title: Economic costs of wind erosion in the United States

articles.author: Xianghan Sun
articles.description: Nature Sustainability - Author Correction: Changes in global fluvial sediment concentrations and fluxes between 1985 and 2020
articles.title: Author Correction: Changes in global fluvial sediment concentrations and fluxes between 1985 and 2020

articles.author: Weiping Wang
articles.description: Recycling lithium (Li) from spent Li-ion batteries (LIBs) can promote the circularity of Li resources, but often requires substantial chemical and energy inputs. This study shows an electrochemical method enabling Li recycling from spent LIBs with electricity generation and minimized chemical input.
articles.title: Electrochemical lithium recycling from spent batteries with electricity generation

articles.author: Felipe S. Pacheco
articles.description: The aquaculture sector in the Amazon is an important source of food and livelihood provision; however, it is associated with environmental and ecological risks. This Review assesses aquaculture in the Amazon, offering insights into the challenges and opportunities for its sustainable growth.
articles.title: Towards sustainable aquaculture in the Amazon

sources.title: Nature Ecology & Evolution

articles.author: Luíseach Nic Eoin
articles.description: Nature Ecology & Evolution - Indigenous communities share how to live with wildlife
articles.title: Indigenous communities share how to live with wildlife

articles.author: Vera Domingues
articles.description: Nature Ecology & Evolution - Ancient history of MX antiviral proteins
articles.title: Ancient history of MX antiviral proteins

articles.author: Taro Matsuo
articles.description: Cyanobacteria use both chlorophylls and phycobilins to absorb light energy, and authors here use cultivation experiments, numerical simulations and protein phylogenetics to argue that cyanobacteria evolved in a green-light environment during the Archaean era in which green-specialized phycobilins would have been selectively advantageous.
articles.title: Archaean green-light environments drove the evolution of cyanobacteria’s light-harvesting system

articles.author: Justine Bell-James
articles.description: Analysis of the 36 National Biodiversity Strategies and Action Plans that were submitted to the Convention on Biological Diversity by 21 October 2024 reveal that no nation has yet created a plan that meets all elements of targets 2 and 3 of the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework.
articles.title: Ambitions in national plans do not yet match bold international protection and restoration commitments

articles.author: Sarah P. Saunders
articles.description: On the basis of data from >329,000 migratory birds, this study presents multispecies migratory connectivity as a parameter representing exposure to global change and shows that connections between breeding regions in Canada and non-breeding regions in South America are at greatest risk from global change.
articles.title: Multispecies migratory connectivity indicates hemispheric-scale risk to bird populations from global change

articles.author: Ye Li
articles.description: An analysis of single-cell RNA sequencing data from adult and developing lungs across vertebrate species reveals genetic components in the common ancestor of jawed vertebrates and new lung-specific enhancers that contribute to the evolution of vertebrate lungs.
articles.title: Origin and stepwise evolution of vertebrate lungs

articles.author: Filipa I. P. Samarra
articles.description: Filipa Samarra is hooked on killer whale behaviour.
articles.title: Killer whale (Orcinus orca)

articles.description: Ex situ plant collections are key tools in the fight to preserve biodiversity. Numerous opportunities and challenges exist among their many different forms, but all are valuable.
articles.title: Planting for posterity

articles.author: Patrick T. Rohner
articles.description: Analysing wing shapes within and across distantly related dipteran lineages, the authors show that intrapopulation variation reflecting microevolutionary change can predict deep divergence at macroevolutionary timescales spanning 185 million years, and suggest that this pattern can be explained by correlational selection related to allometric scaling.
articles.title: Macroevolution along developmental lines of least resistance in fly wings

articles.author: Shilin Tian
articles.description: A comparative analysis of bat genomes, including five newly assembled chromosome-scale genomes, provides insights into the diversification of horseshoe bats and reveals molecular adaptations with a potential role in antiviral immune response.
articles.title: Comparative genomics provides insights into chromosomal evolution and immunological adaptation in horseshoe bats

articles.author: Sophus O.S.E. zu Ermgassen
articles.description: Semistructured interviews and focus groups with experts in biodiversity finance in Europe identify opportunities and barriers to upscaling private investment in biodiversity, and emphasize that public policy is the key to enabling progression.
articles.title: The current state, opportunities and challenges for upscaling private investment in biodiversity in Europe

articles.author: Isabel M. Serrano
articles.description: Nature Ecology & Evolution - Author Correction: Mitochondrial somatic mutation and selection throughout ageing
articles.title: Author Correction: Mitochondrial somatic mutation and selection throughout ageing

articles.description: This study introduces a method to systematically compare the functions of homologous (shared) genes between the X and Y chromosomes (gametologues) across the human body. The authors discover differences that are linked to the evolutionary histories of these genes and could contribute to sex-biased biology and disease.
articles.title: Insights into the human sex chromosomes from divergence between the X–Y gametologues

articles.author: Isabel M. Serrano
articles.description: Nature Ecology & Evolution - Addendum: Mitochondrial somatic mutation and selection throughout ageing
articles.title: Addendum: Mitochondrial somatic mutation and selection throughout ageing

articles.title: Reinforcing the Significance of Crop Diversity for Biodiversity Conservation in the Face of Agricultural Expansion

articles.title: Estimation of Carbon Dioxide Removal via Enhanced Weathering
